channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Huge tree branch blocking pavement on Sumner Street, 3rd February
item.description:
It looks like a vehicle has broken off a large bit of tree. The branches are totally blocking the pavement on Sumber Street, just after the junction with Zoar Street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Great Guildford Street, Southwark, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car, 3rd February
item.description:
This car has been sat here for months, this road has a high level of traffic and lots of cars park here for the hospital and schools. Residents surge to park most day.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Thelma Gardens, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter from burst rubbish bags, 3rd February
item.description:
This continues to be an ongoing issue as the council has taken bins away from some of the flats in the street. Therefore neighbours have no option but put bags on the pavement. Therefore neighbours bags have been ripped open by foxes, rats and crows. Litter, rubbish and food is now scattered over the street again which requires removal.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Domestic Items Left outside No.23, 3rd February
item.description:
Domestic items left on pavement outside of the property. Items deposited in the location on Saturday 31 January by occupant of the property. The occupant moved on Saturday morning leaving the refuse behind.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Abbey Wood Road, Abbey Wood

item.title: An absolute filthy constant mess, 3rd February
item.description:
You can't make this up! The lorry comes to FINALLY empty the big bins and leaves all the rubbish on the floor at the side of it. WHAT'S THE POINT IN COMING AT ALL??? This area is constantly filthy! Absolutely disgusting!!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bridge Gardens, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dunstall house marmont Road, 3rd February
item.description:
The bins are both full. Rubbish and fly tipping building up. There is rubbish strewn all across Marmont Road from the full bins and when they are emptied. It looks terrible and attracts seagulls and rats.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Staffordshire Street, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
